field.name: summary
field.value: BlogSample-vs2003 generates several errors in VS2008 and will not compile using RC3

field.name: description
field.value:
I have installed RC3 of the for Castle. I downloaded the Getting Started example for ActiveRecord (BlogSample-vs2003). I am using Visual Studio 2008 (VS2008) and it upgraded the project without errors. When I attempted to compile I did get several mentions about missing *.resx files for the forms. I deleted these from the project. That seemed to take care of that and i was able to double click on the form name (ex: PostManagement.cs) and see the form in the designer. I then attempted to rebuild the Solution, but at that point I get the following error:
Error 1 The name 'CountAll' does not exist in the current context C:\Documents and Settings\mmurphy\My Documents\Visual Studio 2008\Projects\ActiveRecordInitAndConfig\Models\User.cs 63 11 BlogSample-vs2003
Is there a fix for this?

comment.author: mzywitza
comment.text: Trunk contains an working VS2008 Project file for this sample

comment.author: mzywitza
comment.text: * '''Resolution''' set to ''Fixed''. * '''Version Fixed''' set to ''Future''. * '''Status''' changed from ''Open'' to ''Resolved''.
